description.narrative: Since mid-April, tensions between Palestinians â€“ many of whom protested against the longstanding threats of eviction by Jewish settlers â€“ and Israelis in East Jerusalem resulted in street violence. Fighting escalated following the intervention of the Palestinian militant group Hamas, firing rockets into Israel, and airstrikes by the Israel Defense Forces on Gaza. At least 119 people have died in Gaza, including around 30 children, and 800 have been wounded. Eight have been killed in Israel. Humanitarian needs in Gaza were already high across sectors prior to conflict escalation, with protection assistance and access to health services being a priority. PRCS is the leading humanitarian organization providing emergency medical services (EMS) to victims of violence and conflict across all of occupied Palestine during this crisis, as it is during all of Palestineâ€™s crises. The EMS assistance is provided through different centres, and the emergency advanced medical posts, as well as at the PRCS hospitals. On 10 May, PRCS activated its central operations room in Gaza, and all branches, centres, staff, and volunteers have been alerted and teams ready to respond as needed. The current capacity responding to the increasing cases of casualties includes 28 ambulances with 420 emergency medical personnel and volunteers, and currently, the Al-Quds hospital is being prepared to receive cases and to utilize its operation rooms and intensive care units, when required. As fighting and attacks across Gaza escalate, the scale and nature of impact are widening, affecting nearly all of Gazaâ€™s civilian population. As of 14 May, PRCS has dealt with a total of 572 injuries and 55 fatalities. On 14 May alone PRCS dealt with 107 cases, including 6 fatalities. This is 66 % of all people reported as injured by MOH.
